headline: Original Ranch Spinach Dip
description: This crowd-pleasing appetizer features a hollowed-out loaf of French bread filled with a creamy mixture of sour cream, spinach, water chestnuts, and Hidden Valley® Original Ranch® Seasoning Mix.
name: Original Ranch Spinach Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) packet Hidden Valley® Original Ranch® Salad Dressing & Seasoning Mix
1 (10 ounce) box frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained
1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts, rinsed, drained and chopped
Assorted, fresh vegetable sticks cut up for dipping

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together dips mix, sour cream, spinach and water chestnuts. Chill 30 minutes or until just before serving.
Cut top off the bread and remove center (using firm bread pieces as dippers). Fill bread bowl with dip. Serve with cubed bread and vegetables.

review.reviewBody: I use a mix of mayo, sour cream and a little miracle whip. I can't stand the taste of miracle whip on it's own but it gives this dip a little kick. I also add diced bell pepper for more crunch. Red bell peppers near christmas so it looks red and green.
Simple and delicious! I added 2 cups of shredded mozzarella, will definitely make again.
Love it - but I do 8oz mayo and 8oz sour cream. Just personal taste. I also add green onions.

I have been using this recipe for years. It is often requested.
I replace the water chestnuts with artichoke hearts.
Very tasty however I omitted the chestnuts.
Very good, definitely will make again!

I normally use home made ranch seasoning, but was short on time so bought the packet. It was saltier than desired as a result, but still tasted great and I would make again with my home made version ranch. I served with french bread and baby carrots.
Omitted water chesnuts and french bread for a very Keto/low carb option friendly. I paired it with plain pork skins and also celery sticks for delicious snacks.
Very good. I added half mayo and half sour cream. Served with raw veggies.

This is delicious! I read all of the reviews about it being too salty and was only going to use 1/2 of the ranch dressing package but as I kept tasting ;) I ended up using the whole thing and it was perfect as written! Thank you

I have been making this recipe for years and it is always a big hit. We entertain for several holidays throughout the year and this is a constant on our appetizer menu. I serve in a bowl with a tray of thin-sliced French bread, as well as a tray containing a variety of crackers.

Simple to make but it was way to salty with the ranch pack I had to add more sourcream to get rid of the salty taste in addition I also added garlic powder to taste ..it turned out great but becareful with the ranch pack
I love Hidden Valley Ranch dip made from the packet, but I think the flavor is too over-powering for this recipe.

2 disclaimers - I am not a huge fan of spinach dip and I can't stand mayo. But spinach dip is always a crowd pleaser so I hold my nose and make it. So, when I saw this receipe and realized it did not involve mayo, I had to try it and I am glad I did!! My grocery store was out of sourdough rounds so I served it in a bowl with cubed sourdough bread. It was a huge hit!! The bowl looked like it had been licked clean. This one is a keeper!!

I first tried this recipe back in September 2012 for a Sunday dinner party and it was a big success. I have made it a couple more times since then for get togethers and myself. I do add a small amount of some strong, pungent flavored cheeses when I make it for myself because that is how I like it. The down side is I don't know the starting calorie count before I add the extra cheeses and I tend to eat more of this dip then I should. Yes it is that good.

I used my own homemade dry ranch dressing in this dip recipe and reduced fat sour cream. I did add a touch of Frank's Hot Sauce for a little kick. I wanted a more uniform dip. What I did was throw all the ingredients into my food processor and pulse until smooth. THEN, I chilled the dip for an hour before serving. I loved the combination of all the ingredients together but you know, I really think this dip could use some parmesan cheese. Not much, just a touch to give it a little bit of that flavor.
Extremely simple, great tasting spinach dip!
